intro: Psychotria muscosa subsp. breviloba, commonly known as the short-stalked psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland rainforests. The subspecies is notable for its unique morphology and is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological and potential medicinal significance.
